name: Gatte Ka Pulao
history: Gatte Ka Pulao, also known as Ram Pulao, is a Rajasthani dish. It combines the flavors of Gatte (gram flour dumplings) with the fragrant Basmati rice, embodying the essence of Rajasthani cuisine.
description: This dish features cooked Basmati rice mixed with spicy and flavorful Gatte (gram flour dumplings), seasoned with traditional Indian spices. It's a delightful blend of textures and flavors.

equipment.name: pan
equipment.description: For making the gatte and sautéing the spices.

ingredients.quantity: as needed for cooking rice and gatte

instructions.title: Prepare the Gatte
instructions.description: Mix gram flour, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, salt, and a little oil to form a dough. Roll into thin cylinders and boil in water until they float to the top. Cut into small pieces.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: Wash the Basmati rice and cook it until it's almost done. Drain any excess water.

instructions.title: Make the Pulao
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add the boiled gatte and sauté for a few minutes. Add the cooked rice, garam masala, and adjust salt. Mix gently.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish the Gatte Ka Pulao with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with raita or any side dish of your choice.

tips: Ensure the gatte are not overcooked; they should be firm.
Fluff the rice gently to avoid breaking the grains.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or carrots to the pulao for extra nutrition.
Experiment with different spices or herbs for variety in flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave, adding a little water if needed.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative serving dish, garnished with fresh cilantro.
Pair with a cooling raita or a tangy side salad.
